required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study for PRO of CML in Real Word
clinical_study.official_title: Validation Value of the Questionnaire to Assess Health-related Quality of Life in Patients With CML
clinical_study.source: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: Successful outcomes in CML require both prolonged adherence to oral TKI therapy by patients and careful monitoring of treatment responses by their physicians. Patient Reported Outcomes(PRO) assessment is important to facilitate decisions in the current treatment landscape of CML.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Above 18 years of age.
2. Patient with confirmed diagnosis of Philadelphia chromosome positive and/or BCR-ABL positive chronic myeloid leukemia (CML).
3. Written informed consent.
4. Patients enrolled in investigational drug-trials or other type of clinical trials are also eligible.

primary_outcome.measure: Assess health-related Quality of Life and Symptom Burden in patients with chronic myeloid leukemia
primary_outcome.description: Health-related quality of life (HRQOL) assessment in the current treatment landscape of chronic myeloid leukemia

study_pop.textblock: Above 18 years of age. Patient with confirmed diagnosis of Philadelphia chromosome positive and/or BCR-ABL positive chronic myeloid leukemia (CML).

facility.name: Department of Hematology, Nanfang Hospital, Southern Medical University,

contact.last_name: Department of Hematology Nanfang Hospital Southern M University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Nanfang Hospital of Southern Medical University
